member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler
member.summary: A CheckoutHandler does all the business logic required to complete an order. Inherit from this base class to extend to checkout logic in Dynamicweb Ecommerce Cart.
member.remarks: Make use of the Dynamicweb Configurable AddIn API to add editable properties to the checkout handler.

member.summary: Returns the name of the request value that CartV2 should look for in order to forward the call to the CheckoutHandler's Redirect method.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.HasServerCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the payment gateway makes a callback request to the server with payment transaction details or not. Use order.SaveGatewayResult to save transaction details in callback processing. Default value is false.
member.value: true if this instance has server callback; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets the OrderId based on the CheckoutHandler redirect parameter.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether CartV2 should redirect to CheckoutHandler.
member.value: true if CartV2 should redirect to CheckoutHandler; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.ParameterSeparator
member.summary: Gets the string used as parameter separator when FormSubmit is called.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.StartCheckout(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order)
member.summary: This method is called when the checkout procedure is started and the order is handled to the checkout handler.
member.param: The order that need to be checked out.

code.title: Example
code.description: This is the actual implementation of the default checkout handler which is called if no checkout handler is selected on the payment.

example.code: Public Overrides Function StartCheckout(ByVal order As eCommerce.Orders.Order) As String LogEvent(order, "StartCheckout") Try SetOrderComplete(order) LogEvent(order, "SetOrderComplete succeeded") Catch ex As Exception LogError(order, "SetOrderComplete failed with the message: {0}", ex.Message) End Try CheckoutDone(order) RedirectToCart(order) Return Nothing End Function

member.remarks: Return a string to control the module output. If a redirect is made, like in the example, it is not needed to return a string.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.Redirect(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order)

summary.para: Function that is called from CartV2 when OrderIdRequestName is in the Request.
Implement this method to receive redirects from CartV2

member.param: The order with order ID equal to the request OrderIdRequestName
member.returns: Returns the output to the module.

code.title: Example
code.description: Example of how to create an url that will be redirected to this checkout handler's Redirect method when called:

remarks.para: The most common use of this method is to receive callbacks and redirect urls from a gateway.

To enable the Redirect method to be called on a callback parse an url with the current page id and the order id in the query string to the gateway as the callback url. The order id must be stored in a query string variable named with the return value of the property OrderIdRequestName of the CheckoutHandler base class.
Return a string to control the module output. If a redirect is made within the method, it is not needed to return a string.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.CheckoutDone(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order)
member.summary: This method should be called when the handler is done with the checkout even if the checkout fails.

code.title: Example
code.description: This is the actual implementation of the default checkout handler which is called if no checkout handler is selected on the payment.

example.code: Public Overrides Function StartCheckout(ByVal order As eCommerce.Orders.Order) As String LogEvent(order, "StartCheckout") Try SetOrderComplete(order) LogEvent(order, "SetOrderComplete succeeded") Catch ex As Exception LogError(order, "SetOrderComplete failed with the message: {0}", ex.Message) End Try CheckoutDone(order) RedirectToCart(order) Return Nothing End Function

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.RedirectToCart(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order)
member.summary: This method should be called when ready to redirect back to the cart.

code.title: Example
code.description: This is the actual implementation of the default checkout handler which is called if no checkout handler is selected on the payment.

example.code: Public Overrides Function StartCheckout(ByVal order As eCommerce.Orders.Order) As String LogEvent(order, "StartCheckout") Try SetOrderComplete(order) LogEvent(order, "SetOrderComplete succeeded") Catch ex As Exception LogError(order, "SetOrderComplete failed with the message: {0}", ex.Message) End Try CheckoutDone(order) RedirectToCart(order) Return Nothing End Function

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.LogEvent(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an event. This is written in the event log.
member.param: The current order or null. This is used to link the log entry to the order.

remarks.para: It is highly recommended to make use of the logging methods of the CheckoutHandler base class.

The LogEvent method creates a single line entry to the event log file, with the time of the event, the order id and the message. If the order given is not null, the entry is also linked to the order, making it visible in the order details view of the admin area.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.LogEvent(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order,System.String,Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.DebuggingInfoType,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an event. This is written in the event log.
member.param: The current order or null. This is used to link the log entry to the order.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.LogError(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an error. This is written in the error log and in the event log

remarks.para: It is highly recommended to make use of the logging methods of the CheckoutHandler base class.

The LogError methods creates a text file of all known system information including session variables, server variables and more. All objects logged are parsed and sub-objects stored in properties are also logged down to a certain level.
This log file can easily consume several Mb of disk space, wo use only LogError on true errors. Otherwise use LogEvent.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Cart.CheckoutHandler.LogError(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an error. This is written in the error log and in the event log
member.param: Optional Exception that caused the error

remarks.para: It is highly recommended to make use of the logging methods of the CheckoutHandler base class.

The LogError methods creates a text file of all known system information including session variables, server variables and more. All objects logged are parsed and sub-objects stored in properties are also logged down to a certain level.
This log file can easily consume several Mb of disk space, wo use only LogError on true errors. Otherwise use LogEvent.

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.SalesDiscounts.SalesDiscountProvider
member.summary: The SalesDiscountProvider allows you to invent your own discount types from scratch and apply them to an order, or to extend the built-in discount types in the Sales Discount module. All SalesDiscountAddIns need to override a function called ProcessOrder, which is the function that is called when Dynamicweb eCommerce goes through all the SalesDiscountAddIns searching for discounts. This allows the whole procedure to be more flexible, allowing you to decide how your SalesDiscountAddIn should work.
member.example: This code sample shows how to make a SalesDiscountProvider that triggers discount if the total sum of purchased products (“Order total amount”) exceeds the specified amount.

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Gateways.GatewayProvider
member.summary: Base class for creating a setting page for the payment gateway.

example.code:
Public Class MyGateway Inherits GatewayProvider Public Overrides Sub Render(ByVal template As Rendering.Template, ByVal TagPreFix As String) MyBase.Render(template, TagPreFix) template.SetTag(TagPreFix + ".Email", Email) template.SetTag(TagPreFix + ".Price", Order.Price.Price.ToString("0.00", CultureInfo.InvariantCulture)) End Sub
Private _Email As String Public Property Email() As String Get Return _Email End Get Set(ByVal Value As String) _Email = Value End Set End Property End Class

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.FeeProvider
member.summary: The FeeProvider allows you to manipulate the shipping fee of an order in eCommerce using class inherited from Dynamicweb.eCommerce.Orders.FeeProvider.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to grant free shipping to customers who posts multiple orders within 24 hours. If the web shop can ship the items from the first and second order together, there is no need for the customer to be double-charged for shipping and handling. In cases where no previous orders have been submitted, the FeeProvider simply returns null which then will cause Dynamicweb eCommerce to ignore the FeeProvider when it sorts out the shipping fee.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.FeeProvider.FindFee(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order)
member.summary: Finds the fee for the order that should replace standard ones.
member.returns: Returns shipping fee for the specified order

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Orders.Order.IsCaptureSupported
member.summary: Return "true" if the payment method of this order supports remote capture feature. Capturing an order allows to withdraw or cancel payment directly while order placement. In this case, user does not need to log in the gateway administration system to be able to cancel the order.

If the group both have selected a product category And have the 'Inherit fields from parents', the set of fields which is available in the group, should a be a the combined set of fields from the selected Product Category and all product category fields from the parent. member.summary: Inserts the given product at the specified index.
member.remarks: If the index is less the zero then the product will be inserted at the beginning of the list. If the index is greater (or equal to) the number of products in the collection then the product will be inserted at the end of the list.

If True, then the same product can be added more than once. Otherwise it will not be added again

members.member:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to remove VAT from the current price. ''' true if price calculation should remove VAT from the current price; otherwise, false.
The VAT is only removed if prices in the database include VAT. Otherwise, price calculation does not change with the value of this property.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Prices.PriceProvider.PreparePrices(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Products.Product,System.Double})
member.summary: Prepares prices for a list of products coming from a cart or order context. Must be overriden.
member.remarks: This method is called before the actual use of each products price. This method is called once per instance (i.e. showing a list of orderlines in a cart or order) where FindPrice is called once for each product in the list. Use this method to find all the prices needed in the upcoming FindPrice calls. This method can be used to retrieve i.e. 30 prices from an ERP system and saved into a cache that is later used by FindPrice.
member.param: The products with a list of products and their quantity in the current cart or order.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Prices.PriceProvider.PreparePrices(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Products.ProductCollection)
member.summary: Prepares the prices for a list of products shown in the frontend - usually a product list or a list of related products, favorites etc. Must be overriden.
member.remarks: This method is called before the actual use of each products price. This method is called once per instance (i.e. showing a list of products) where FindPrice is called once for each product in the list. Use this method to find all the prices needed in the upcoming FindPrice calls. This method can be used to retrieve i.e. 30 prices from an ERP system and saved into a cache that is later used by FindPrice.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Prices.PriceProvider.PreparePrices(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Products.Product})
member.summary: Prepares the prices for a list of products shown in the frontend - usually a product list or a list of related products, favorites etc. Must be overriden.
member.remarks: This method is called before the actual use of each products price. This method is called once per instance (i.e. showing a list of products) where FindPrice is called once for each product in the list. Use this method to find all the prices needed in the upcoming FindPrice calls. This method can be used to retrieve i.e. 30 prices from an ERP system and saved into a cache that is later used by FindPrice.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Prices.PriceProvider.FindPrice(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Products.Product,System.Double,System.String,Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.International.Currency,System.String,Dynamicweb.Security.UserManagement.User)
member.summary: Finds the price for a given product in a given context. Can be called to show the price of a product, show the price of a product for a specific user, unit etc. Must be overriden.
member.remarks: This method is called in 2 contexts. For showing a product and a product added to a cart or order. If the call comes from an order object, it can have a quantity of 2 or more and can be used to return the unit price for a product that is cheaper if more than one is bought
member.param: The product to find the price for.
The quantity - usually 1, but if the product comes from an order or cart it can be higher. See remarks.
The variant id of the current product.
The currency in which the price is required.
The unit id of the product.
The user for whom the price is valid for.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Prices.PriceProvider.FindPrice(Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Products.Product,System.Double,System.String,Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.International.Currency,System.String,Dynamicweb.Security.UserManagement.User,System.Double)

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Ecommerce.Prices.PriceRaw
member.summary: Represents a placeholder for an amount and a currency. PriceRaw is a simple unqualified price, that's mostly used internally by the PriceManager or by PriceProviders.
member.remarks: A PriceRaw have no indicators to tell if VAT is included or if rounding have been perfomed. If you need to work with qualified prices, use PriceInfo.
